channel.title: Training Setup on SageMaker Deep Dive
channel.description: Recent content in Training Setup on SageMaker Deep Dive

item.title: Launch a SageMaker notebook instance
item.description: Note: In this workshop, we’ll be using an Amazon SageMaker notebook instance for simplicity and convenience. You can use any local client to perform steps detailed in this and subsequent sections. You’ll just need to make sure you have the right privileges to access AWS services such as SageMaker, S3, ECR and others from your client. You’ll also need to install AWS Command Line Interface (AWS CLI), python, boto3 and SageMaker SDK.

item.title: Download the workshop content
item.description: Launch JupyterLab client and clone the workshop repository Your notebook instance should now be ready. Click JupyterLab to launch your client. Click File > New > Terminal to launch terminal in your JupyterLab instance. Download the workshop code and notebook. Change directory to ~/SageMaker, download and unzip the labs file. If the wget command doesn’t work, try copying the link above and using it as the wget parameter.
